Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	 Here begins the words of Al-Bukhari.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	 O, sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the knowledge of medicine, and its completion has achieved its purpose, and through its explanations and clarifications, it seems to me that I should complete it for you with this treatise, which is a section of the operation by hand, which is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	 For the operation by hand is suppressed in our region and in our time, it has been greatly neglected, and its knowledge has been lost; only a few descriptions remain in the books of the Ancients, which have changed many [things] and have come to errors and confusion, so that their intentions are closed and its strength and art are lengthened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	 And it seems to me that I should revive [the operation by hand] with the arrangement of this treatise according to the way of explanation and clarification and abbreviation; and so that it may come in the form of cautery tools and other instruments of the work as it is for the addition of clarification, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	 But the reason why a good craftsman with his hand is not found in this our time is because the art of medicine is long, and its practitioner must first be trained in the science of anatomy, which counts Galen among those who knew the position of the members and their forms, and their connection and separation; and had knowledge of the bones, nerves and sinews, and their number, and their arrangement; and of the pulsating veins and the still ones, and the places of their outlet.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	 And for this, Hippocrates says that with a name it is nothing, but in the work little, and mainly in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	 But we have already spoken of that in the beginning of this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said regarding anatomy will fall into error by which many people die, as I have seen happen too often. For some are educated in this science and then disregard it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	 For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor cut an apostema scrophulous on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries of the neck so that a great amount of blood flowed out until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	 And I saw another doctor who took it upon himself to remove a stone from a man who was in a bad state, and the stone was large. He tried to pull out that stone with a piece of the bladder, which caused that man to die on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	 And I had been called to remove that stone, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew for certain that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	 Here's the line-by-line translation of the given sentence:
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	 And then release him according to his desires, and then bind him again, and let him lie dry for some days, and command that we untie the bandage; and thus enter until the space and the foot were inflamed, and it came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	 And I was called to him, and prepared to untie the bandage, and then calmness was achieved and thus he admitted his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	 However, corruption had already taken hold in the member, so it could not be restrained, and the corruption continued to spread throughout the member until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	 And I saw another doctor who punctured a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after some days, until the evil of it was greatly magnified in him.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	 The cause of which is that the cancerous tumor is full of melancholic humor, so it is not necessary for it to be cut out entirely, but only enough to be hosted by the member in its entirety.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	 And for this reason, my sons, it is necessary for you that the operation be divided into two parts: one is the operation associated with health, and the other is the work in which the greatest danger lies.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	 And I have already mentioned this in every part of this book where an operation occurs that involves error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave it, so that the pages do not find a way to speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	 And therefore take up your weapons with diligence and under the protection of God, and your patients with joy and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	 And use the best method through the grace of God to achieve healing and praiseworthy success, and abandon the terrible illnesses that are difficult to cure, and keep your weapons away from what makes you afraid, so that reliance on your faith and your name does not escape you: for greater is your glory, both in this world and forever after your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	 France has already been dissected in some of its monasteries:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	 "Do not treat evil patients, lest you be called evil doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	 And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	 Here begins the division of the book, and firstly of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	 The first chapter is about the head, particularly concerning the shapes of instruments and the irons of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	 The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	 The second chapter on incisions and punctures, as well as cupping therapy, pustules, extraction of arrows and similar matters, all categorized and organized according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	 Division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	 The third chapter on restoration and dislocation, and on the treatment of fractures and similar conditions; a chapter organized from head to toe, including the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	 On cauterization with fire and sharp medicine, and remembering the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	 With this begins the entire treatise of the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	 It should be noted that I will explain the qualities of the preparations for this cautery and its contraindications, as well as in which complexity it is prohibited to cauterize.  (A more natural translation might be: "I want to discuss the qualities of the preparations for this cautery and its contraindications, as well as the conditions under which cauterization is prohibited.")
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	 Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the preparations for cautery and its contraindications is a long and detailed discourse, subtle in science and secretly hidden; and many wise men have already spoken about it, disagreeing among themselves. For me to repeat all their discourses would be too lengthy.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	 And therefore I say that you should apply cautery universally to any condition with or without matter, except for two conditions which are called cold conditions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	 In a cold and dry condition with matter, you will disagree; for some say that cautery is beneficial for that, while others say the opposite about it, that cautery is not suitable for an illness caused by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate that a cold and dry illness with water that is hot and dry be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	 And I disagree with those who say the opposite about this, that by cautery every cold and dry illness that occurs in the body of men is helped; for when you compare the human body and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	 And I say by this reasoning that experience has already shown me many times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	 However, it is not necessary to dwell on this matter which has already been proven and practiced in the chapter on cautery by previous practice, and he knows the diversity of human conditions and the nature of illnesses within them, as well as their causes and accidents, and the time span for them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	 In other cases, there is no need to worry about it, especially in damp and cold ailments, because all doctors agree on this, and they do not disagree on the use of cautery for these.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	 And know, children, that concerning the secret of healing through fire and its goodness, it is agreed upon to use burning cautery in medicine, because fire is simple and its action only reaches the member being cauterized and not other adjacent members except for slight harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	 However, the action of medicine applied through burning spreads to adjacent members, and it quickly brings healing to the sick member that is difficult to heal and quickly helps.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	 But fire, due to its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not cause this except for superfluities. And it is known to us through experience and long years of service in studying the art, concerning the truth of causes; and therefore I am excused from lengthy discourse. And if it were not that my book is not read here, I would have hidden a secret with fire and the quality of its operation in the body and its expulsion by which it expels sicknesses, with philosophical demonstrative discourse, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	 And know, children, that they disagree about the time in which it is appropriate to make a cautery and they consider the best time to be spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	 And I say that cautery is appropriate at any time, because the harm caused by the unfortunate circumstance of time is submerged in the benefit that comes from applying the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for painful or necessary pains, such as fistulas, which do not tolerate delay, lest something worse should happen.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	 And this should not be in your thoughts, O children, because only the common people and foolish doctors think this way, as if to say that the ailment which is cured by cautery does not recur at all times, and they consider this outcome.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	 And the reason is not as they think, because cautery is only used in places where medicine cannot reach to change the complexion and dry out the humidity that causes pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	 But nevertheless, cautery is superior to medicine in its strength and the effectiveness of its operation, as well as the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	 And it is possible that his ailment may return at some point in time, according to the patient's complexion and the location of his ailment, as well as his strength and what has been prepared in his body for the accumulation of excesses within him, and what he has received in his diet from similar causes; unless the ailment treated with cautery is a subtle ailment with few superfluities and humors, such as a tooth cautery for pain, it is possible that the pain will not return to him. But this only happens rarely.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	 And it is commonly said that the cautery is the last resort in medicine, and this is a correct statement, for I do not understand why they apply it, since I believe it is not a cure that benefits either with medicine or with any other means except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	 And the reason is contrary to that; and the belief that cautery is the last resort in medicine only applies when one administers various methods of treatment for certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer benefits, and therefore at the end of the process one administers cautery, and it is beneficial for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	 And from this one can see that cautery is the last resort in medicine, not according to the opinion that I understand the common people and too many foolish doctors hold.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	 And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	 And they said that the place of cautery does not burn, although this is not absolutely true, for I have already proven and found that it does so only in some bodies without the others, and cautery with that is good and better than with iron as well; however when you make a cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, for it ignites according to the quantity that you want by the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive friction. And if you place on it a flame, the gold melts from the fire, and some flakes fall into the fire due to the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	 And for that reason, you should make the cautery with iron in a way that is as gentle and precise as possible for the operation to proceed correctly.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	 And I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those from the head to the feet, so that I can provide what is needed for him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	 On the cautery of head pain caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	 The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	 This cauterization is effective against moisture and cold, which are two causes of the said accident, being the cause of soda and many rheumatic fluxes called rhinitis, which flows from the head to the area around the eyes and ears, much sleepiness, toothache and sore throat, and universally for all diseases that come from cold, such as paralysis, soda and apoplexy, and similar conditions in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	 The way to perform this cauterization is as follows: first, instruct the patient to be evacuated with a purgative that cleanses the head for three or four nights, depending on the strength of the patient and their age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	 And then instruct him to shave his head with a razor, and then make that seated patient sit between your hands on a bench and place his feet on it.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	 And then place the palm of your hand gently on his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	 But once your finger reaches the middle of the nose, mark that spot with ink, and then use a cautery tool shaped like an olive leaf.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	 Then place that [cautery tool] on the marked spot and press down gently, gradually increasing pressure with your other hand, and rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	 Then gently lift your hand and look at the spot. If you see any bone exposed, even as small as a grain of sand, then stop and lift your hand. If not, continue with that iron, or another one if it has become cold, until you see the bone as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	 Then take a little salt and dissolve it in water, then apply it to the spot for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	 Then place a cloth soaked in vinegar on it and leave it there until the scar of the burn is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	 Then treat the spot with Tetrapharmacum ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	 And they also say that the longer the wound remains open, the better the arm will be healed, because it is more beneficial and helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	 And some of them say that the tendon should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be held in place until a portion of the bone's substance is burnt off.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	 And then it should be scraped and cleaned of anything attached to the bone, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	 And others say that with the cautery one should reach the very back, until it presses strongly into the bone, causing it to break, and this is the method of small apoplexy:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	 And they believe that from that place, the vapors of the head are expelled.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	 And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	 But I have not seen these two types of cautery in all cases, only in some men according to the way of fear; and let him be, in my opinion, better with health than without it, for the head is weakened by the breaking of its continuity, just as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	 And the first type of cautery, in my opinion, is safer and better; and with this I end and with this I work for health.
Capitol segon.	 "Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	 "About Cautery of the Head

"Incise the membrane and expose as much bone as we mentioned earlier, then cauterize him with a cautery on the back of the head in the place called 'vas' — and this is the location where a cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	 "And be careful with this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will find great pain from this, different from the pain of all other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	 "And I say this about the location of this cautery, because the cautery used for the crown of the head and the occiput should be more delicate than the one used for the middle of the head; and this is how it should be done.
Capitol ters.	 Based on the context provided and similarities with Romance languages, "Capitol ters" likely translates to:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	 Of the recent cautery for migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	 When the pain in the head is severe, or it extends to the eyes, evacuate the head with cleansing medicines and administer the other treatment that I have mentioned in the discussions of illnesses; if this does not help, then cautery on him is done in two ways: either cauterization with a sharp burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	 But cauterization with a burning medicine is done by taking a woolen cloth and cleaning it well and tying off its ends on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	 Then you must cut the painful area in the temple with a sharp lancet, until it reaches the bone, so that it is hidden underneath.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	 Then press strongly on it with a stopper to increase the pressure, and leave it for the space of three hours; then remove it and take out the wool, and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then place over it a cloth soaked in wine vinegar until the area becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	 And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written in the treatise of twelve burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	 But in cauterization with iron according to this manner: here is how it's done with the cautery, and this is its form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	 and it is called a nail-like hook, because the head of it is like a small flower in which there is some curvature, and in the middle part of it there is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	 Then place [the cautery] over the area of pain, and hold your hand—so that the bow does not get burned, which is below—and rotate the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	 And if the quantity [of skin] burned by the tip of the cautery is as much as half of it, lift your hand so that the blood vessel below is not burned, to prevent bleeding from occurring.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 And then soak a cloth in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; and then place a cloth with padding, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	 And if you wish, cauterize with the blade of the scalpel according to this manner, and be careful not to cut the artery in this area especially.
Capitol quart.	 Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	 On the Cauterization of an Old Wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	 When you treat migraine with the water we have mentioned in the previous treatment, and as we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses, and if the treatment does not work, sometimes due to the illness not responding to what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then you must heat the scalpel cautery until it is red-hot. This indicates the place of pain along a line equal to the length of the majority finger, or whichever one; and place your hand once and press firmly until you reach the artery and it penetrates into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	 However, it is necessary for you to be careful of the continuation of the jawbone, which becomes thicker due to chewing, and that the ligament is not attached there and the nerves that cause pain in that area do not become spastic.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	 And if it is concerning the safety and caution of blood flow from the artery that is cut, because in its cutting there is fear, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not trained or experienced; leave the operation to one who has experience at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	 And I come with the reminder of the management of bleeding from the artery according to its own manner in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	 Here's the translation of the given sentence:

And if you go, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on the tension of archery with cauteries having two blades, and this is a better cauterization and more effective.
Capitol .v.	 Chapter V:
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	 About the cauterization for earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	 When the ear hurts due to cold and is not cured with purgative remedies or other treatments mentioned in the division, then apply the cautery, which is called puncture. Then pierce close to the fire and guide it around the entire ear as if turning a wheel, or in a circle on each side if the pain is on one side.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	 Hold the cautery near the edge of the ear, gradually approaching the spot to be cauterized.

Capitol .vi.	 Chapter VI
De cauterizacio de turtura.	 About the cauterization for sore throat.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	 Sore throat, which is cured with cauterization, occurs only due to the humors that come through phlegm, as mentioned in the division of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	 "Avoid cauterization of the spine due to dryness or nerve spasm.

"When you heal that kind of throat with jars and purgatives and gargles, and your cure does not succeed, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	 "Place your cautery opposite the affected area, because softening occurs only in the part that appears healthy.

E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	 "And this is the form of the cautery, and it is similar to a knife, whose form is shown below.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	 And then care for the area with water that is previously processed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	 Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	 On the Cautery of Ancient Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot. E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	 And the manner of the cautery is done as it was said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	 And now that you have cauterized on the mouth of the stomach, and it is worse afterward, then care for it with processed water.
Capitol .viii.	 Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	 On the Cautery of Forgetfulness Caused by Fever.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	 Give to the patient at the beginning large cups and pills to cleanse the humors.

E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	 And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then cure the cautery with the water that has been prepared.

Capitol .ix.	 Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	 On the Cauterization of the Parazilus and on Softening the Entire Body.

E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	 And then care for that (area) until it is healed, and this should be cauterized with olive oil.
Capitol .x.	 Chapter 10
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	 Of the Cauterization of Epilepsy
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	 One should not cauterize an epileptic unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	 Therefore, it is necessary to cleanse the brain at its beginning with years and with the other treatment that we have mentioned in the division, when the patient is great and tolerant of the rejection of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	 And if it is a child who cannot tolerate medications, then administer strengthening and chewable mixtures that cleanse, for several days, with the improvement of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	 Then shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize that (area) with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the aforementioned method, and with another cautery on their occiput, and on each corner of the head, also cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	 And if the patient is strong and enduring, then cauterize them with cauteries as I have described, after having caused paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	 And let it be a cautery with olive oil as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	 But if the patient is a child, then use a fine cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	 Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	 On Cauterizing for Melancholy
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	 When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidity and thick flame, then cauterize with the cauteries that we have mentioned, in having caused paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	 And if the cause of melancholy is a decline into superfluity, and the patient's body is wet, then give them water that purifies their brain according to what has been said before in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	 And then shave the patient's head, and then make a decently made circle from it, and then place that in the middle of the head. ‌
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	 And let the patient be sitting calmly, and let them be held on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	 Then place an ointment; and it is more suitable to use old sheep fat.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	 And warm him over a moderate fire, which is said to benefit him when he is most in need of it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	 Then place him in the middle of his head with the circle, and let him be cooled within it until he is chilled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	 And do this with the patient once a week, along with his other treatment, until he is healed; or if you prefer, cauterize him by making small points according to his constitution, but make sure to have a hand with a cautery arranged in such a way: this is the type of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	 Then place this cotton ball soaked in wine or in linseed oil.
Capitol .xii.	 Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	 On the Cauterization of Water Descending into the Eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz. E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	 And have him sit in a bath of warm water for several days.

And then instruct him to shave his head, and cauterize him with a cautery in the middle of his head; and then cauterize him with two cauteries on both temples if the water is issuing from both eyes, or with one strike if it is issuing from one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	 In this case, you should make incisions with the cautery on all the veins and arteries that are below the collarbone; and the cauteries should be placed at a distance from each other, equal to the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	 And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see any bleeding from it, stop the blood with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	 And I come with wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in their removal, as well as in the prevention of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	 And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck under two bones with two very thin cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	 Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	 On the Cauterization of Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	 Of the cauterization for a smelly nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	 When you treat that with the water we mentioned in the division and your treatment does not work, then prepare [a mixture] and give the patient the [following ingredients] to drink for three nights; and after that, shave his head, and cauterize him with a cautery of iron and a cautery of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	 And then cauterize that area with a clove cautery, using two cauteries on both eyebrows near the hairline, but just a little bit.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	 And be careful with the cautery so that you do not burn too deeply.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	 And this is the way to make a clove cautery.
Capitol .xv.	 Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	 Of the use of a cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	 When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery made with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	 And if you, cauterize that above both eyebrows with a small amount of cautery on both sides, in all parts, and they should be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	 And let the length of each cautery correspond to the width of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	 But do not press too hard with your hand on the cauteries; instead, according to the amount that one-third of the eyelid is burned.
Capitol .xvi.	 Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	 Of the cautery on the eye when the hairs are turned inside and the eye is inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	 When the hairs of the eye are turned inside so that they prick the eye, cauterizing in these cases is done in two ways, because cauterization can be either with fire or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	 If by cauterization with fire, command the patient before this to let their hair grow as those who have them shaved until they are prolonged and thinned out; and if that is the case, you must strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that it does not worsen until the hairs grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	 Therefore, when they have grown back and thinned out, then place the head of the patient in your lap, and carefully mark on the eyelid of his eyes with a tent, with a sign that is according to the shape of a holly leaf, and let the beginning of the sign be near the hairs. ›
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	 And then place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or in a paste made from flour on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	 And then prepare the cautery, which has this form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	 And then cauterize on the figure that you have drawn, little by little, in visible spots, until the surface of the kidney is burnt, which appears like a myrtle leaf, very clearly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	 The sign of the success of this operation is that you see the eyelid of the wound already contracted and the hair on it raised due to the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	 Therefore, raise your hand and leave it for three days, and then place on it cotton with a border until the scar has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	 But if the hairs return for any reason and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another cautery on it just as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	 But if the hairs remain on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural place and healed, so that the hairs do not touch the eye.

E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	 And do not hide the path of righteousness from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	 Chapter XVII
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	 Of cautery for a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	 When you treat a fistula with the water we mentioned in the division of diseases, and your treatment does not work, then you should cauterize it as follows: command the patient to put his head on your lap, and have another person hold the patient's head between their hands so that it is not moved or shaken.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	 Then place a piece of cotton dipped in egg white or honey and flour over the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And then heat up the cautery, which looks like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	 Which should be concave, as is the shape of a reed or a vulture's feather, one end of which is used to make the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	 And if you want it to be, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	 "And if you want it to be thus as you intend.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	 "But however, the one who is skillful is better suited for this task.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	 "Then immediately press the fistula if it is open, and draw from it the pus and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	 "And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	 "Then immediately place the cautery on it, which should be well-lit. With that skilled hand, hold a little below the tip of the cautery at the base of the nose, so that your hand does not burn or cause discomfort to the patient. Then place the cautery in the grooves of the nose and apply heat to it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	 "And so if at the beginning of your cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, as needed; and leave it like this for three days. Then place a plaster over the spot and surround it with drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	 "But if twelve days have passed and it is not healed, then apply over it a caustic medicine until the bone is exposed and scraped according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora. And if the fistula is healed with the water we have mentioned from the cautery and treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer an incision of the nose and reduce the fistula back into the body of the nose according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	 Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	 About the cauterization of the split in the feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	 Often such splits occur on the lips, and especially on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	 Therefore, when you cure these splits with the water we have mentioned in the divisions and your cure does not work, then burn the cautery with a small knife according to this form that follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	 And let its concavity be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	 Then place that carefully in those splits until the cautery reaches the depth of the splits.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	 And then cure it with plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	 Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	 About the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	 When an abscess forms at the root of the uvula or on the palate or at the root of the teeth, and it begins to fester, and it breaks open, and it heals, but continues to fester and a fistula is formed, and you cure it but the cure does not work, then you should ignite a cautery according to the size that fits in the fistula, and put that ignited [cautery] into the opening of the fistula, and keep your hand there until the hot iron reaches its depth, and do this once or twice; and then cure it with the water we have mentioned for the treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	 And therefore, if the wound is healed and has been healed, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to uncover the area and remove the rotting bones as it will be explained in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	 Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	 About the cauterization of teeth and the softening of veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	 When veins are softened by humidity and teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines but they do not improve, then place the patient's head in your lap, and ignite the cautery of the form which will be shown later, so that you place the spoon over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, holding it with your hand a little inside so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	 And then lift up your hand, and then repeat with the cautery several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	 And then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then spit it out, because the decayed tooth is sealed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupt humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	 Chapter XXI
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	 "On the cautery for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	 "When toothache is due to coldness, or if there is an abscess or worm in the tooth, and you do not administer medicine for the cure, then you should cauterize it according to two methods: either cauterize with a cow's horn, or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	 "Cauterize with a horn by taking a cow's horn and filling it with hot iron filings, then take cotton and wrap it around the tip of the horn, next immerse it in hot iron filings and place it on the painful tooth immediately until it becomes numb.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	 "And repeat this process several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	 "And if you prefer, dip wool or cotton in the aforementioned horn [filings], and place it on the painful tooth, then place hot iron on top until the heat reaches the depth of the cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	 "However, the cauterization with fire is that you pay attention to the tip of an awl or needle, and there be some thickness in its core so that the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	 And then heat the cautery in the shape that will be used, and place it on the tooth until the cautery is heated; do this several times because the pain will be reduced either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	 It is necessary that the patient fills his mouth with good odor from the impression of that cautery and holds it for one hour, and then spits it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	 And use the cautery on whichever extremity you wish, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	 And this is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	 Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	 Of the cauterization of hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	 When hernias are caused by phlegm and cold humors and do not respond to digestion with medicines and you wish to achieve light digestion of those, then heat the cautery as follows: it should have two openings so that smoke can escape from one opening, and place the heated cautery on the swelling once, or twice if needed, until it reaches the core of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	 And if the swelling is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the swelling, and leave it for three days, and then place a cloth soaked in good odor on it until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	 And then care for him with ointments, bandages, and cloths until he is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	 And the shape of the needle or cautery should be thus conveyed.
Capitol .xxiii.	 Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	 On the cauterization of a hoarse voice and constriction of breath.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	 When moisture comes over the passage of the lung, and especially when this is with coldness of complexion, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at first with purgative medicines, and afterwards you must cauterize him in the region of the throat in the depressed area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	 And be careful not to go too deep with the cautery into the throat, nor burn more than a little of its length.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	 And then you must cauterize him with another cautery in the joint of the neck at the last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	 The cautery for this should be heated as described before.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	 Then care for him with the water previously mentioned until he is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	 Chapter 24
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	 On the Cauterization of Lung Ailments and Coughing
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	 When coughing and lung ailments are due to cold moistures, and the patient has no fever or tisics, and it is an old ailment, then you should cauterize him with two cauteries on the furcula in the depressed areas, one on each side; and with another cautery in the middle of the sole of the foot between the two mamillos; and the cauteries should be heated as described before.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	 And if you wish, let your cauterization be done with the pointed instrument called "punctum," whose shape should precede in the treatment of earache pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	 And place points [or: make incisions] into these areas; and then care for it with the water that has been prepared beforehand until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	 And let there be three parts to the cautery, for cauterization is done with this: in one application you can perform three cauteries according to this method:

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	 On the cauterization of the head of the little finger.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	 When the head of the little finger is dislocated due to excessive moisture and does not return to its proper place within the hour, you should wait for the dislocation until it customarily returns, and then with a small movement, it will return to its place, as we have shown.
